queue.tweet: US equities closed mixed as Nasdaq hit a fresh high on AI optimism, while the S&P 500 and Dow paused. Week ahead: Fed meets Sept 16–17 with rate-cut odds rising; Nvidia/mega-cap earnings; and inflation/payroll data in focus.
queue.summary:
Nasdaq posts a fresh high on AI leadership.

Broad market remains mixed as rotation and mega-cap earnings influence sentiment.

Week ahead features the FOMC decision, Nvidia earnings, and key inflation data that could tilt policy expectations.

queue.tweet: Trade idea: Bull call spread on SPY — buy 650 strike call and sell 670 strike call, expiring Sept 19, 2025. If SPY closes above 670, max profit; if not, limited risk equal to net premium. Near-term setup supported by SPY trading near 647.
queue.summary:
SPY sits in the mid-600s as policy expectations and earnings set the tone.

The proposed play is a bullish call spread: long 650 call, short 670 call, with Sep 19, 2025 expiry.

This structure offers defined risk with upside if price moves higher; monitor liquidity and costs.
